articles.title: Colorado Flood Shuts Highway With Damage 'Unlike Anything' Seen Before
articles.description: It's the latest example of how weak our infrastructure is in the face of multiple climate catastrophes.
articles.content:
Well, it’s finally infrastructure week and not a moment too soon. On Sunday, Colorado’s crucial east-west artery of I-70 shut down indefinitely “due to extreme damage from the latest round of flooding” to hit the state.

articles.title: Man violates restraining order by renaming estranged wife’s Napster playlists
articles.description: An Ohio man violated a restraining order against his wife by renaming Napster playlists in an attempt to communicate, an example of music metadata becoming a harassment vector.
articles.content: An Ohio man harassed his estranged wife through a shared Napster account, evading a no-contact order by changing the titles of playlists. Ohio’s Eighth District Court of Appeals outlined the case in a July 29th ruling, which was flagged on Twitter by... [2009 chars]

articles.title: PM Modi a remarkable example of person with scientific temper: Union minister Jitendra Singh
articles.description: Speaking at a science event, Singh said scientific temper is much more important than scientific qualification. He also said Gandhi’s ‘ahimsa’ was a ‘silent biological warfare’.
articles.content:
Text Size: A- A+
New Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is one of the most remarkable examples of a person with a scientific temper, Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh said Monday.

articles.title: How an Irish Olympian's Tokyo viral hit made us marvel at Japan's amazing public toilets
articles.description: Japan's public toilets are an example to the world
articles.content:
Amongst the Irish Olympians in Tokyo who made headlines in Japan since the Games got underway was Irish rugby sevens player Harry McNulty.

articles.title: Religious groups eye legal challenges to Delta variant restrictions and vaccine mandates
articles.description: The Supreme Court set new boundaries last term, voting, for example, 5-4 in one case in April to block California's restrictions on at-home gatherings.

articles.title: Windows Central readers are not sold on the Surface Duo 2's camera setup
articles.description: The Surface Duo 2 leaks have brought divided opinions. Windows Central readers, for example, aren't big fans of the new camera setup.
articles.content: As of this moment in time, during the writing of the post you're currently reading, the "Do you like the leaked Surface Duo 2 camera setup?" poll sits at 1,034 votes. Most readers (37.43%, 387 votes) do not like the Duo 2's camera situation, 33.66% (... [1269 chars]

articles.title: The PS5's Apple TV Plus trial is a rare example of a genuinely great freebie
articles.description: Apple TV Plus has a free trial running on PS5 until next year, and the timing couldn't be better.
articles.content: I watched Boys State at the weekend on Apple TV Plus. Have you seen Boys State? I would guess you probably haven't – not that it's much of a metric, but it's got just over 4,200 ratings on IMDb, compared to around 19,000 for Netflix's American Factor... [5048 chars]

articles.title: Cash for jabs: Labor proposes $300 for everyone who gets vaccinated
articles.description: Following the example of countries including the US, the UK and India which have incentivised vaccination, Labor has proposed a cash payment to encourage Australians to get jabbed while providing a stimulus for businesses.
articles.content:
Labor is proposing a one-off cash incentive for everyone who gets vaccinated in the next four months, a sweetener that could make lockdowns a thing of the past by Christmas.
